=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Feds
Review Date: 2012/12/26
Store: Dan Goldbery  (Director),     Ken Marshall  (Actor),     Fred Dalton Thompson  (Actor)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Action & Adventure
Product Description: ['Ex-Marine Ellie and shy bookworm Janis are fledgling female Feds who\'d make Eliot Ness proud. More importantly, they\'ll make you laugh. Starring as these plucky FBI recruits are gangbuster comediennes Rebecca de Mornay (Risky Business, Wedding Crashers) and Mary Gross (Saturday Night Live, A Mighty Wind). "Brawny" Ellie and "brainy" Janis go together like ham and eggs, and their lives will be hilariously scrambled during their hilarious, hectic training. Janis must learn physicality and intimidation techniques, while Ellie needs a guiding hand to help get through the intricacies of constitutional law. So in true buddy fashion, they\'ll help each other prepare for the academy\'s final exam: a "simulated crime exercise" that chauvinistic lunkheads think will separate the men from the girls.']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy, Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Fred Dalton Thompson, Larry Cedar, Mary Gross, Rebecca De Mornay, Dan Goldbery, Ken Marshall', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Director': 'Dan Goldbery', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 23 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 7, 2010', 'Actors': 'Ken Marshall, Fred Dalton Thompson, Rebecca De Mornay, Mary Gross, Larry Cedar', 'Studio': 'WB', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: This has always been one of my favoriet movies and was glad to get it at such a reasonable price.
Review Title: Great Movie
Rating: 5.0

=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Good Neighbors: The Complete Series 1-3 (DVD)
Review Date: 2012/12/26
Store: Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, BBC, All BBC Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Good Neighbors: The Complete Series 1-3 (DVD)', "On Tom Good's fortieth birthday, he decides to escape the rat race for a life of self-sufficiency with his wife, Barbara. Soon they're plowing a field in their suburban yard and tending a goat and pigs, much to the dismay of their upwardly mobile neighbors and friends the Leadbetters. This series, known as", 'The Good Life', 'in the UK, enjoyed such popularity the queen requested a viewing, and as recently as this year it was listed as one of the top ten British sitcoms of all time.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'Originally telecast in the 1970s,', 'Good Neighbors', 'is the wonderful 1970s Britcom about an upper-middle-class couple who relinquish consumerism and turn their cozy suburban London home into a self-sufficient farm. Tom (Richard Briers) and Barbara (Felicity Kendal) Good trade in one version of the good life for an impoverished other--an old tractor instead of a car, a goat instead of a purebred pup--to the continuing consternation of their best friends and executive-salaried neighbors, Jerry (Paul Eddington) and Margot (Penelope Keith) Ledbetter. Among the episodes contained in the first three series are "Pig\'s Lib," in which Margot covertly seeks help from the local residents\' association to stop Tom\'s plans for keeping pigs; "Just My Bill," in which Tom and Barbara face the rare problem of a harvest surplus that has to go somewhere; "Mutiny," in which poor Jerry is caught in a crossfire of obligations to both his boss and bossy Margot; "Going to Pot," in which the Goods come close to abandoning their self-sufficiency ethic when Tom proves a profitable craftsman at the potter\'s wheel; "The Happy Event," in which the birth of new livestock is wonderful news for the Goods but a sore point with the Ledbetters; and "The Last Posh Frock," featuring Barbara at the end of her rope when her last nice dress gets torn. As always, the series\' concept ultimately takes a back seat to the lovely chemistry among four outstanding actors, and story lines that wisely emphasize relationships. Fans of British television would do well to look into', 'Good Neighbors', '.', '--Tom Keogh']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Various', 'Language': 'English, Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '4', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.5 x 1 inches; 4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2262105', 'Director': 'Various', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '10 hours and 40 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 13, 2006', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Studio': 'BBC Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '4'}
Review Text: This series is timeless - always funny. I had it on VHS and was glad to be able to purchase it on DVD at such a reasonable price.
Review Title: Great British Comedy
Rating: 5.0

Product Title: Houseboat
Review Date: 2013/07/05
Store: Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
Product Description: ['Houseboat (DVD)', 'Cary Grant scored still another box-office smash with his 1958 vehicle H ouseboat. Grant plays a widowed father who packs himself and his spoile d kiddies off to a ramshackle houseboat. Enter Sophia Loren, who is atte mpting to break loose from her tyrannical father\' s (Eduardo Cianelli) i ron grip. She hires on as Grant\'s housekeeper and his children\'s governe ss. Though Grant struggles valiantly t o maintain a "hands off" policy, he and Loren are billing and cooing by fadeout time—but not before plent y of reversals, recriminati ons and sitcom-style mishaps. As a bonus, th e kids end up behaving like little angels (not surprising, since Loren h as threatened fr om time to time to turn them into genuine angels if the y don\'t toe the line). According to most sources, the on-screen romance betwe en Cary Grant and Sophia Loren in Houseboat spilled over into thei r private lives as well, though Sophia put an end to this dallianc e whe n she married Italian movie mogul Carlo Ponti.', ']]>']
Average Rating: 4.8

Review Text: Cary Grant is handsome and funny and romantic as he always is and will be in my mind. Even in his final years, he was an enigma.

['Ex-Marine Ellie and shy bookworm Janis are fledgling female Feds who\'d make Eliot Ness proud. More importantly, they\'ll make you laugh. Starring as these plucky FBI recruits are gangbuster comediennes Rebecca de Mornay (Risky Business, Wedding Crashers) and Mary Gross (Saturday Night Live, A Mighty Wind). "Brawny" Ellie and "brainy" Janis go together like ham and eggs, and their lives will be hilariously scrambled during their hilarious, hectic training. Janis must learn physicality and intimidation techniques, while Ellie needs a guiding hand to help get through the intricacies of constitutional law. So in true buddy fashion, they\'ll help each other prepare for the academy\'s final exam: a "simulated crime exercise" that chauvinistic lunkheads think will separate the men from the girls.']

Tom (Richard Briers) and Barbara (Felicity Kendal) Good trade in one version of the good life for an impoverished other--an old tractor instead of a car, a goat instead of a purebred pup--to the continuing consternation of their best friends and executive-salaried neighbors, Jerry (Paul Eddington) and Margot (Penelope Keith) Ledbetter. Product Title: Feds
Review Date: 2012/12/26
Store: Dan Goldbery  (Director),     Ken Marshall  (Actor),     Fred Dalton Thompson  (Actor)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Action & Adventure
Product Description: ['Ex-Marine Ellie and shy bookworm Janis are fledgling female Feds who\'d make Eliot Ness proud. More importantly, they\'ll make you laugh. Starring as these plucky FBI recruits are gangbuster comediennes Rebecca de Mornay (Risky Business, Wedding Crashers) and Mary Gross (Saturday Night Live, A Mighty Wind). "Brawny" Ellie and "brainy" Janis go together like ham and eggs, and their lives will be hilariously scrambled during their hilarious, hectic training. Janis must learn physicality and intimidation techniques, while Ellie needs a guiding hand to help get through the intricacies of constitutional law. So in true buddy fashion, they\'ll help each other prepare for the academy\'s final exam: a "simulated crime exercise" that chauvinistic lunkheads think will separate the men from the girls.']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy, Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Fred Dalton Thompson, Larry Cedar, Mary Gross, Rebecca De Mornay, Dan Goldbery, Ken Marshall', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Director': 'Dan Goldbery', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 23 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 7, 2010', 'Actors': 'Ken Marshall, Fred Dalton Thompson, Rebecca De Mornay, Mary Gross, Larry Cedar', 'Studio': 'WB', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}

Product Title: Good Neighbors: The Complete Series 1-3 (DVD)
Review Date: 2012/12/26
Store: Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, BBC, All BBC Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Good Neighbors: The Complete Series 1-3 (DVD)', "On Tom Good's fortieth birthday, he decides to escape the rat race for a life of self-sufficiency with his wife, Barbara. Soon they're plowing a field in their suburban yard and tending a goat and pigs, much to the dismay of their upwardly mobile neighbors and friends the Leadbetters. This series, known as", 'The Good Life', 'in the UK, enjoyed such popularity the queen requested a viewing, and as recently as this year it was listed as one of the top ten British sitcoms of all time.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'Originally telecast in the 1970s,', 'Good Neighbors', 'is the wonderful 1970s Britcom about an upper-middle-class couple who relinquish consumerism and turn their cozy suburban London home into a self-sufficient farm. Tom (Richard Briers) and Barbara (Felicity Kendal) Good trade in one version of the good life for an impoverished other--an old tractor instead of a car, a goat instead of a purebred pup--to the continuing consternation of their best friends and executive-salaried neighbors, Jerry (Paul Eddington) and Margot (Penelope Keith) Ledbetter. Among the episodes contained in the first three series are "Pig\'s Lib," in which Margot covertly seeks help from the local residents\' association to stop Tom\'s plans for keeping pigs; "Just My Bill," in which Tom and Barbara face the rare problem of a harvest surplus that has to go somewhere; "Mutiny," in which poor Jerry is caught in a crossfire of obligations to both his boss and bossy Margot; "Going to Pot," in which the Goods come close to abandoning their self-sufficiency ethic when Tom proves a profitable craftsman at the potter\'s wheel; "The Happy Event," in which the birth of new livestock is wonderful news for the Goods but a sore point with the Ledbetters; and "The Last Posh Frock," featuring Barbara at the end of her rope when her last nice dress gets torn. As always, the series\' concept ultimately takes a back seat to the lovely chemistry among four outstanding actors, and story lines that wisely emphasize relationships. Fans of British television would do well to look into', 'Good Neighbors', '.', '--Tom Keogh']
Average Rating: 4.7

Grant plays a widowed father who packs himself and his spoile d kiddies off to a ramshackle houseboat. Enter Sophia Loren, who is atte mpting to break loose from her tyrannical father\' s (Eduardo Cianelli) i ron grip. She hires on as Grant\'s housekeeper and his children\'s governe ss. Though Grant struggles valiantly t o maintain a "hands off" policy, he and Loren are billing and cooing by fadeout time—but not before plent y of reversals, recriminati ons and sitcom-style mishaps. As a bonus, th e kids end up behaving like little angels (not surprising, since Loren h as threatened fr om time to time to turn them into genuine angels if the y don\'t toe the line). According to most sources, the on-screen romance betwe en Cary Grant and Sophia Loren in Houseboat spilled over into thei r private lives as well, though Sophia put an end to this dallianc e whe n she married Italian movie mogul Carlo Ponti.', ']]>']

raw_response:
The individual exhibits a strong preference for comedies, particularly British sitcoms, and classic films featuring iconic actors. Key themes in their purchases include:

- **Comedic Preferences**: Frequent purchases of comedies demonstrate a preference for humor and lighthearted entertainment, particularly from British sources, as seen in consistent purchases of acclaimed sitcoms.

- **Iconic Actors**: They favor classic film stars, expressing admiration for performances by distinct figures known for their charm and comedic timing.

- **Series and Collections**: There is a tendency to acquire complete series, indicating an interest in binge-watching and a commitment to following episodic narratives.

- **Nostalgia**: Many purchases are driven by nostalgia for earlier television shows and films, highlighting a longing for familiar and fondly remembered entertainment.

- **Reality TV**: Aside from scripted comedies, reality programs focused on police and daily life indicate an enjoyment of engaging, real-life scenarios blended with humor or excitement.

- **Mixed Reactions**: The individual expresses a mix of excitement and disappointment across various genres, suggesting a discerning taste that appreciates depth in character development and storytelling.

Overall, this person's shopping history reveals a profound affinity for comedic storytelling, classic cinema, and nostalgic programming spanning various media formats.

target_interaction.title: Even Better
target_interaction.text: I really like this movie and was really excited to see the uncut scenes - made moments make more sense.
description: Newly re-mastered Single-disc ulitmate edition, starring Kurt russell and James Spader.
Nothing beats a sci-fi movie with wall-shaking sound, and the
Ultimate Edition delivers the goods with 6.1 DTS ES and 5.1 Dolby Digital EX. Yes,
has been released on DVD numerous times, but this 2003 version is the best yet, with improved sound and a generally clean picture that's now anamorphically enhanced for widescreen televisions.
Ultimate Edition is a stripped-down version with only a featurette and commentary track.
